metadata.title: CVE-2021-42252 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in aspeed_lpc_ctrl_mmap indrivers/soc/aspeed/aspeed-lpc-ctrl.c in the Linux kernel before 5.14.6.Local attackers able to access the Aspeed LPC control interface couldoverwrite memory in the kernel and potentially execute privileges, akaCID-b49a0e69a7b1. This occurs because a certain comparison uses values thatare not memory sizes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42252` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-90-generic - 5.4.0-90.101~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-162.170').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-90.101~18.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.104').
linux-raspi2-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1046.50~18.04.1').
linux-ibm-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2').
